definitions.definition: difficult in an interesting way that tests your ability

examples.text: I have had a challenging and rewarding career as a teacher.
He found the course academically challenging.
The tasks were not challenging enough for me and I got bored.
We have changed the course to make it more challenging.
It will be a challenging target to meet.

definitions.definition: done in a way that invites people to disagree or argue with you, or shows that you disagree with them

examples.text: She gave him a challenging look. ‘Are you really sure?’ she demanded.
Dealing with challenging behaviour in school is never easy.
